alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 5:27AM EST until February 19 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Manchester Street and Miller Road east of US 25 E flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage by evening to reach a crest near 28.9 feet just after midnight early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.9 feet on 02/01/2013. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued 5 PM EST.
